name: genotype-pytorch-tensors
title: Genotype Tensors
summary: A tool to load the vectorized genotype information files

inputSpec.name: Genome
inputSpec.label: Goby Indexed Genome
inputSpec.help: The genome that the reads were mapped against, indexed with Goby.

inputSpec.name: Model_Archive
inputSpec.label: Model archive
inputSpec.help: Model as a .tar.gz archive, containing the files inside the model directory.

inputSpec.name: Model_Label
inputSpec.label: Model Label
inputSpec.help: The name of the model (included in the model archive) to use for genotype calling.

inputSpec.name: Checkpoint_Key
inputSpec.label: Checkpoint Key
inputSpec.help: The checkpoint key of the model (included in the model archive) to use for genotype calling. E.g. if the model file is pytorch_YNCRX_best.t7, the checkpoint key is YNCRX.

inputSpec.name: Num_Slices
inputSpec.label: Number of slices
inputSpec.help: Number of slices to compute in parallel.

inputSpec.name: Sample_Name
inputSpec.label: Sample Name
inputSpec.help: Name of the sample to store in the .vecp file.

inputSpec.name: Image_Version
inputSpec.label: Docker Image Version
inputSpec.help: The version of variationanalysis-app image to use in the execution.

outputSpec.name: Predictions
outputSpec.label: Predictions
outputSpec.help: The genotype calls, in VCF format. The regions where calls are made, in Bed format.
